Mini MDCXCVIII

Welcome players, and thanks for signing up to my first game on this site. I hope you have fun!

The players
[01] Bulbazoor
[02] dragonspawn
[03] GrayFoxxxx
[04] FA_Q2
[05] implosion
[06] Boonskiies
[07] spicer1209 < Necessary Evil
[08] Shazam
[09] pisskop
[10] Annarchy < StubbsKVM
[11] Firebringer < TheDominator37 < MarioManiac4
[12] Kublai Khan
[13] Titus < Persivul < WoodyWoodpecker

Game status
The game ended with a lynch on day 4.
Final write-up can be found here.

Town is victorious!

Rules & mechanics

Site-wide rules apply

Gameflow
Dayphases last 12 days.
Nightphases last 2 days.
This is open to debate (preferrably during the pre-game or confirmation stage or through PM).
Deadlines will generally be at 00:00 CEST (which is GMT + 1 + DST). This depends a bit on other plans I may have in the evening, however, I'll usually keep the dealine where it is, and delay the write-up for one or two hours.
If an absolute majority has been reached for a lynch, the next night will start at the next available deadline.

Roles
Your role PM will state the following:
The name of your role.
Your alignment. Either Town (#6bd7c6) or Mafia (#6b39c6).
Any abilities you may have.
Your win condition.
Spoiler: sample vanilla townie role PM
Role
Vanilla townie

Alignment
Town

Abilities
None.

Win condition
You win when all players not aligned to town are eliminated, and at least one player aligned to town survives.


Win conditions
The usual.
Town: You win when all players not aligned to town are eliminated, and at least one player aligned to town survives.
Mafia: You win when nothing can prevent the mafia from eliminating all other players who are not aligned to mafia.

Voting
As usual. During the day, you may vote for the player you want to lynch. You may do this by bolding vote: player or using the vote tags. New votes will replace old ones. You may remove vote (or unvote) to remove your vote altogether. No lynch is an acceptabe vote.
Lynches (or no lynches) require an absolute majority, meaning a number of votes equal to at least 50% of the active players, rounded down, plus 1.
Once an absolute majority has been achieved, the (no) lynch is locked, and no new votes will be counted. The player to be lynched may talk until the write-up for the night start has been posted.

Abilities
If you have an active ability, you may PM me with your action any time during the turn (i.e. day-night cycle). You may change your target any time before the nightphase deadline.
Your role PM will state if you have any abilities, and what they do.
If the event of ability interactions, there is a set order of priority (complying with natural action resolution).

Feedback
There will be no feedback, unless a role PM states otherwise, or in the case of your death. If you're due some feedback, you will receive a PM from me with the subject: mini 1698: report.

Activity
Prods after 48 hours, after which players have 24 hours to respond. After no response, or 3 prods, I will seek a replacement.
At game start, you confirm by the way stated in your welcome PM. When 11 players have confirmed, the game starts. Players who do not confirm within 48 hours get a prod.

Miscellaneous
All (or most) of the usual things, and some other things.
Don't edit your posts (if you can).
Don't post when dead.
Don't quote PMs.
Don't talk about the on-going game outside the game thread.
Please be civil.
The mafia has daytalk.

Questions and/or comments
If you have questions, or want to point out mistakes, you can either PM me (please use "mini 1698: question" or mini 1698: comment or mini 1698: mistake in the subject), or just ask / comment / notify me in the thread. Bold and red text is surely going to get my attention.

Rules are subject to change

I wouldn't call making plays like that burning bridges. I don't think you should adapt your scum play for the sake of making your life as town better; you ought to just do whatever it takes to win as both.

If you don't want to make moves like fake-giving up as scum then I also am fine with that, I just don't think you ought to fault a player who does that as scum. Altering your play as scum for the sake of meta is not playing to win, hence why trust tells were banned sitewide. If you go out of your way to establish a meta of "I may give up as town, but I'll never give up as scum" then that's tantamount to a trust tell. Even if you don't go out of your way for that, if you do establish a meta like that I feel like you give yourself an obligation to break it so as to play to your win condition.

balance-wise, I'd say this was probably spot-on. I get the feeling players during D3 were assuming there would be a little more town power, but I think it had enough.
I am curious about one thing with regards to the setup - were you going for anything in particular with the way the watcher role worked?

Balance:

First of all, the set-up started out differently. I insist on having my one allowed non-normal role.. But the first one was too non-normal, and wasn't allowed. The 2nd one.. Well the reviewers weren't too enthousiastic, but didn't object either, then it got vetoed by N. The watcher variant was the 3 role. The rest of the set-up changed a bit, though most of the roles were there from the start. It didn't have a gunsmith though.. The reviewers thought it initially was scumsided, so the gunsmith got added. You can view all the drama in the review thread once its public, the link is in the OP.

The role cop could "clear" the doctor, but the watcher would have been an interesting find. As he would have to explain what the variance was.

The vigilante was straight forward. Although next time I should perhaps count it as a mafia power role for balance purposes .

The gunsmith could find 2 out of 3 scumnags, and 2 false positives.

The watcher was a little extra power I wanted to give the mafia. I didn't think it would be too strong, as the most optimal kill is not the most optimal target for watching. Reviewers agreed.

The doctor was there to weaken the vig, but more importantly it was there to function as an actual safeclaim. The role cop could clear him, the gunsmith could clear him, and a mafia doctor is not a common thing. It didn't work out that way in the game though. With the set-up speculation going on, and especially with Boon "speculating" a mafia doctor, it lost its function as a safe claim. Like I said in the dead thread, I personally though Piss had to bus Boon late-game, if he had the chance, but he didn't. He would have had to claim vanilla townie, and get investigated by Spicer, who could "clear" him.

I thought the balance was fine, although it's a little bit hard to tell, with most of them dying early. I also find it funny that 2 power roles replaced out.

For those curious, the first set-up that got rejected had a town "magnet", someone who would redirect to himself. The 2nd rejected set-up had an anonymous voter for the mafia. Common roles for all set-ups were the town role cop and vig, and a mafia doctor.

In post 2059, implosion wrote:I am curious about one thing with regards to the setup - were you going for anything in particular with the way the watcher role worked?

I was already typing the post above but:
I wanted some extra power for the mafia that wasn't too strong.
This was a role with basically 2 powers in one ability, like a jailkeeper. The advantage was that it came at no extra cost, it was "built-in". But it was weaker than a dedicated watcher. In my mind, the player you'd want to kill, is generally not the player you'd want to watch, so I thought that would balance it out. It was a bit luck based, you needed some town players with incorrect reads.
Again, this was after a town non-normal role and another mafia non-normal role got rejected, so I had to come up with something else, and this came out. A shame Bulb didn't get to use it, but as you can see from the actions, it wouldn't have mattered.

I hope you liked the set-up and the non-normal role. I can guarantee there will be one in every normal game I'll mod.

In short: the role cop would simply get the report "watcher (variant)", when targeting the watcher. As that was simply the name I've given him, I didn't have a fancy name for it. Ether wanted it to be a more incriminating name or just give the role cop the full role PM, but I really didn't want to, because, in this case, this would all but confirm the watcher as mafia, which is not something I'd want for a role cop.
